ref: 9571 *bhūva ʻ fine hair ʼ. [In Drav. cf. Mal. pūṭa ʻ down of birds, wool, fine hair ʼ, Nk. būr ʻ down, fine feathers ʼ, &c. DED 3575?]
N. bhuwā ʻ fine down on body of young animal ʼ;
Bi. bhūā ʻ hair on ear of maize, hairy worm ʼ;
H. bhūwā, bhūā m. ʻ a sort of downy cotton from the tree Bombax heptaphyllum, cotton -- wool, caterpillar ʼ, bhuī f. ʻ a sort of insect or caterpillar ʼ;
Si. bū ʻ hairy (of plants) ʼ, būva ʻ down on leaves or fruit or insects ʼ.
